parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To disobey, rebel, be disloyal, refuse conformity. From apeithes; to disbelieve.
At one time or other, at some time, formerly. From the base of pou and te; indefinite adverb, at some time, ever.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To expect eagerly, wait for eagerly, look for. From apo and ekdechomai; to expect fully.
Patience, forbearance, longsuffering. From the same as makrothumos; longanimity, i.e. forbearance or fortitude.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
(Hebrew) Noah. Of Hebrew origin; Noe, a patriarch.
A box, i.e. The sacred ark and that of Noah.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: From kata and a derivative of skeuos; to prepare thoroughly; by implication, to construct, create.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
Puny; especially neuter somewhat.
This; he, she, it.
Eight. A primary numeral; 'eight'.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From dia and sozo; to save thoroughly, i.e. to cure, preserve, rescue, etc.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.
